website_summaries.verdict: Definitely a model to consider if storage space and ease of assembly are factors. We appreciate the sturdy steel construction, large side rails, and smooth walking motion.
pros: Two incline positions, at 6 and 10 degrees
cons: Some complaints about missing parts/tools on arrival

customer_reviews.title: pleasantly surprised / shoes make a difference
customer_reviews.text: Guess I shouldn't have formed any opinion of manual treadmills from the rejects I saw at the thrift stores... This ProGear 190 manual treadmill is surprisingly smooth -- enough that I can mindlessly walk without jerky stop-and-go belt movement constantly calling my attention back to it. Like other people mentioned, I put a 2x4 board under the back feet so it doesn't feel like it's running away with me. This makes for a nice little calm workout. -------------------------------- Different shoes make the belt run smoother or rougher. With my shoes, seems like the narrow-sole squishy-foam ones make it run smoother than the wide-sole harder one do ...
customer_reviews.author: jmr

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Received ahead of schedule. Was very, very easy to put together. It came mostly assembled. I am a 69 yo woman and was able to handle what had to be assembled. Tried it out and it is one heck of a workout. I normally walk about 8000 steps a day and think I am getting a good workout...wrong! This piece of equipment is kick's my butt which is a good thing. I have only had it a few days so the durability still remains to be seen. I researched so many treadmills and based on the reviews settled on this one. Yes, I am EXTREMELY happy with the ProGear 90 Manual Treadmill. It is really worth your investment.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: ... have used the product for 5 weeks and I love it. I get a good workout of it
customer_reviews.text: I have used the product for 5 weeks and I love it. I get a good workout of it. Please note that it took me two weeks to get used to this treadmill because the speed was not set by the manual treadmill, but by your own movements.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Cat

customer_reviews.title: Very basic, and good for me, treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to put together. The treadmill portion was already done, so no worries about trying to fit it to the aide panels, etc. My fault that I didn't realize it was at an incline.... Thereby making it necessary to hold the handles when you walk. I'm up to six minutes now. Lol. Will look for some non-skid 2×4s to put under the backside. Great product when you don't want to spend a lot, and you just want the basics. It does, however, have the tracking system. It scrolls through. I can't get it to stay on just one item. But that's all right. :) :)
customer_reviews.author: Debbi V

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I need at a great price
customer_reviews.text: With the subzero temps and foot of snow recently I was unable to get my 30 minutes of walking in each day. This treadmill is easy to assemble, great for staying on track with my exercise and the price was very reasonable. Takes up little space, and can be easily folded for storage.
customer_reviews.author: sandy7898

customer_reviews.title: If you look up Death Trap in the dictionary, this product is there.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not too safe. The band does not stay in the middle, so it often slips to the left or right side of the support board. This creates a major hazard as the band then gets caught/stuck and sends you flying off. Also, the angle is steep. I've tried to make it less steep, but then it simply doesn't work and needs to be oiled like crazy to remove friction.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lu

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality for LCD display
customer_reviews.text: The LCD display stopped working after a couple of months. If I leave it there for a while it starts working again (so it's not a connection issue). After 20 or 30 mins walking it just freeze and does not continue counting calories or even increasing the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Torres

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Update 27 Nov 2018: treadmill continues to skip and pull hard when trying to walk fast or run, can only be used going very slowly or else it's basically an accident waiting to happen. Have almost fallen multiple times. Should have known better.
customer_reviews.author: Josh L

customer_reviews.title: Belt adjustment bolt stripped out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to assemble. However, at the end of the book is the instructions for realigning the belt. (Which it needed) When I went down to use it I discovered it was completely stripped. Unable to use product.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Don't Trust the Bad Reviews
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases on exercise equipment I've ever made ~ I was a little hesitant only due to the few very negative reviews however decided to trust the overall rating of 4-5 stars. The 1-2 star ratings must be honestly due to poor set up or a very low level of fitness. This does its job, was quite inexpensive, quiet, & perfect for especially the winter months!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces.
customer_reviews.text: It works great and I've had it for a little while now. It's very convenient for my little place. My only complaint is the tilt being too much. I was always having to grip the handles for dear life thinking I was going to fall off. And, yes, I'm short, so that makes it even more inconvenient. However, after putting some cardboard boxes under it to level it just a tad, it's perfect. I do 2-5 miles a day on it and it's not given my wife or myself a bit of problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great for the lazy, non-exerciser
customer_reviews.text: As someone who never, ever exercised this was a great way toward losing those pounds that have crept up over the years. I easily assembled this in a couple of hours and have it placed in my small living room to use while watching TV. My only concern is that you cannot eliminate the incline. I suffer from hip bursitis and walking on the incline did inflame my hip. I ended up placing a couple of bricks under the back to level the treadmill. Now I'm good to go and am gradually increasing my walk time each day.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Lover

customer_reviews.title: parts do not fit together
customer_reviews.text: You can definitely run on it which I am happy about, I would find it hard to walk the track slide so quickly. You need to hold onto the handle bars though or you will fall off. Which made it all the more frustrating that the screws to secure the handle bars do not fit. I might try finding the correct size at the hardware store. It it is very flimsy and looks like it will break easily, which is frustrating since I spent a lot of time reading reviews trying to find one that would be good quality. I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: I wanted something I could easily store and pull out to do my one hour ...
customer_reviews.text: For starters this is obviously not a fancy treadmill so if you want something to run and workout hard with this isn't for you. I wanted something I could easily store and pull out to do my one hour walk when it's to cold or hot to do it outside (and truth be told, watch some netflix at the same time). The setup was easy and fast and it's exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: It took about 45 minutes to assemble with the provided tools. Had I used my socket set and Phillips screwdriver the process would have been a little quicker. Everything fit together nicely. The electronic monitor installed easily and is functional but the print is small. It will give you a work out. The elevation has two settings. Hard and harder. Although it does collapse somewhat for storage, there are no wheels to move it around. You either lift it or drag it. Good treadmill for the price.
customer_reviews.author: 808man

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to store but not for work
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this treadmill. Planned to use it at work but it has proven HARD to use. First if all, it doesn't lay flat - not helpful. It has 2 levels of incline and you must really push to get it going and as soon as you stop, so does it. I thought it was a good alternative to the electric but that is a better option if you expect to walk and type at the same time. I love its size and easy maneuverability. Stores easily and was easy to assemble but it does not work in an office setting. Really bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Holding the Handles are Required
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is okay, I give it a 6 out of 10. I was a bit disappointed because it's walking only, no running, and holding the handles even for walking is an absolute MUST. If you don't hold the handles, you will slip and fall off. This makes it definitely not the right treadmill for anyone elderly that isn't fully aware that you NEED to hold the handle bars the whole time. The pros are that it's easily foldable and easy to store somewhere in a corner.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but had to tweak the sensor
customer_reviews.text: Went together with no problems and seems to work pretty well. Takes a little getting use to, meets my needs. However, the electronic monitor didn't work. Figured out there is a magnet in the right fly wheel that the sensor detects as the sheet turns. I had to add a second magnet in order for the meter to work. See photo. Adjusting the sensor closer to the fly wheel didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: This is a great machine for a workout!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I am 72 yrs. old and assembled this by myself. If you follow directions, it is quite easy. I had a motorized treadmill and this machine, without a motor, is really a better workout. I never felt sore after using the motorized treadmill but with this one you can feel that you had a good workout because you are doing the work to make it move. Also, it is a great space saver compared to a motorized treadmill!
customer_reviews.author: books492

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. Simple improvements would be 1. Raise the bars (this is the primary issue), 2. provide simple belt tension adjustment (the only speed is fast run, you can’t walk on this), and 3. Add more manual incline adjustments. Also the upright closed position needs to lock. I know this is a low cost item, but there are simple changes that could be Mande at nominal cost.
customer_reviews.author: PDEE

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I don't understand why people complain about it, if you want something that works exactly like a real treadmil then buck up and buy one. This this works really well and isn't very wobbly. I'm 5'2 and this is perfect but if you taller than 5'4 this mite be too short for you.
customer_reviews.author: Haley blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those useless products that you shouldn’t buy. It sounds good in theory but it’s not good. The pro is that it’s very light and pretty easy to assemble. But who cares if you can’t use it. If you attempt to run, the speed will go so fast that it’s dangerous. If you walk, you have to stay holding onto the bars which is restrictive and pointless. This product achieves nothing and you’ll probably return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lin

customer_reviews.title: Great Treadmill.  Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this treadmill. You will get a great workout using this and its very durable. Even my Doggie walks on it. Would definately buy again. I do not think its too elevated as some reviewers state. The elevations helps with the workout. Its also easily stored and easy to assembly.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price. Which isn't much.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly once you understand the instructions that can loosely be called english. Comes with everything you need. The fixed incline is a problem and I'd recommend propping it up on something stable in the back. And the belt keeps sliding to the left no matter how much I tighten one side. I didn't expect much and while it's worth ~$95, it definitely doesn't make workouts enjoyable, and barely makes them convenient.
customer_reviews.author: David the WavidTop Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Too Fast - Adjustment did not work
customer_reviews.text: I returned this. It was easy to assemble, but no matter how much I tried to adjust the speed at the base of the treadmill, it continued to be much too fast to use for walking. Unfortunately it did not work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Great for walkers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great size treadmill. I like that it’s self powered and easy folds up for storage. Easy enough to assemble but very heavy! Make sure you put this together in the room you want it in first! Great purchase and great price. Highly recommend for anyone looking to walk a few hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this treadmill. It operates at my pace. The first one I received had a flaw. However the company was quick to respond and replace the part. I would highly recommend this product for anyone that wants a treadmill that doesn't take up a lot of room, easy to put together, no concerns of getting on and off a moving treadmill, and moves at my individual pace.
customer_reviews.author: Lizabeth K. H. Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This product is disappointing. First of all it can't be used at all for running or jogging. When used for walking, right after 2 days the belt started slipping. And the display unit stopped working. I am 5'9" tall, the handles of this product seemed to be not suitable for me as it felt like they are positioned too low to reach comfortably and I started feeling uncomfortable with my back ! I have returned after lesss than 10 days of use. Very disappointing !! Only thing I would say is, it's very easy to assemble and deassemble !
customer_reviews.author: Yadukrishnan Devaraj

customer_reviews.title: I read lots of reviews and I decided to buy ...
customer_reviews.text: I read lots of reviews and I decided to buy it. Since this was my first time to use a manual treadmill, I learned moving it by yourself without any motor help is hard! I guess once you get used to work out with this, it might be OK. But it has been sitting in our living room for a while.....I have to use it....
customer_reviews.author: Yoshie

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it! It’s durable and is easy to fold up. It has a bit of an incline that will take some time getting used too if you are out shape but totally worth it. An Amazon pro came out and set up in like 20 mins (which seem to be included in the price). If you are looking for something smaller that you can fold up and wheel around I totally suggest it. I very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but difficult to use. No way to adjust the speed of the belt. Goes way too fast to be useful. Have to raise the back with a 2 x 4 in order to slow it down. Pain in the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchase

customer_reviews.title: very basic machine; which is what I wanted. ...
customer_reviews.text: very basic machine; which is what I wanted. I would prefer a smaller slant angle and the handles longer or further back for my use. Putting a couple of blocks on the end resolves my first issue. Haven't done anything on my second issue. Overall, this works well for me. I just want to walk, not run.
customer_reviews.author: diana n

customer_reviews.title: I really like the fact that this treadmill gives you a good ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fact that this treadmill gives you a good workout in less time, you really feel the burn after 15-20 minutes of walking. You need to adjust the belt when you set it up and oil it up a little bit for the first use, after that the noise is minimal and you can walk smoothly. I'm enjoying my purchase because I can exercise whenever I want and watch my kids while I'm working out, very good price also!!! I'm only giving four stars because this is not a fancy treadmill but for the price it is really worth it...
customer_reviews.author: Customer1298

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product
customer_reviews.text: When I first got on the tread-mill I thought i was going to fly off. Husband tried tightening the belt per the instructions but instead it’s bumpy. I’ll walk/run and then it’ll suddenly stall. Not great. If it didn’t go past the return date I’d ask Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Roth

customer_reviews.title: GREAT little manual treadmill for only $125!
customer_reviews.text: I had it assembled in less than an hour and it works Great! Very Cool for only $125 when others are 100's or 1000's more dollars. This is a Great Value! The (manual) belt itself moves smoothly when walking, and the belt easily starts and stops with the movement of your legs walking. The Treadmill looks sturdy also, so if it lasts for 1 year, that would be Amazing. So far, I'm Very Satisfied and Pleasantly Surprised with the Quality since it's only $125.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great workout..worth the price and small size is perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little treadmil...love that its manual...gives your legs much more workout cuz you have to make the belt move...and it is not big and bulky like the electric ones...fits perfect...easy to assemble .....so far, very easy to walk on or run....if you want a cute little machine but with the big electric ones workout...this little guy is for you...wish I had gotten it long ago...
customer_reviews.author: stephanne graham

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little treadmill. It is VERY steep and for a newbie its way to hard. I took some of the suggestions on here and put a larger brick at the end to level it out more. It worked perfectly. When I can, I will lower it. Its very easy to put together and use. I like that it is manual and uses my own energy to power it.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Not great but not the worst either
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little hard to walk on needed to elevate the back but that could be just me. Parts were damaged in that they were badly scuffed or nicked. The belt moves to the side a lot and have to realign in the middle of workout. You get what you pay for ....
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not necessarily a small footprint
customer_reviews.text: I gave this three stars because I'm very disappointed and the amount of space it takes up. I just moved into a condo so I have to be very careful about storage. I have a small coat closet and trust me it takes up the whole closet. I do not like that at all. There are others that I've had in the past that are much smaller then this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails!
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those that rarely writes reviews, but this is the best manual treadmill I've ever had. It's super sturdy, the belt stays in place, and it stores easily in a closet. I use this thing pretty hard--like running full speed without holding the rails for intervals-and it stands up really well. It's a great value as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, great for workouts
customer_reviews.text: I love this manual treadmill for the work out I get on it, and for cardio, have switched over to this more than anything else. I did have to turn the tv volume up a little more, but the treadmill isn't really that loud. The incline is adjustable, so I can vary my routine and intensity. I'd definitely buy another one when the times comes for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth a look
customer_reviews.text: I like the size. I like the product. The tread and the arms are well made. The battery operated monitor, cheesy but seems to work..but I am not interested in numbers of miles, just amount of time. I like not worrying about losing power. It was priced reasonably and if I need the space very easy to put away.
customer_reviews.author: brenda boots

customer_reviews.title: This was actually really easy to put together (and I'm terrible with doing things ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, no damage. This was actually really easy to put together (and I'm terrible with doing things like that). I had it put together in about 20 minutes. It takes up very little space. I was afraid that it would squeak, or make some kind of noise when I walked on it, but there isn't much noise at all. I walked on it for a few minutes to test it out, and it was kind of fun. I'm so glad I ordered this. You can't beat the price either. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephenie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It helps me actively walking anytime of the day/night. No need electric power and just perfect on my need.
customer_reviews.author: Annie B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Great, compact, manual treadmill. Perfect for my small living room and in front of the TV, and easy to assemble with clear instructions. I assembled it by myself within an hour. I'm 5'1" and 135 lbs so this treadmill size is perfect for me as I approach my 51st birthday and continue to age.
customer_reviews.author: Honolulu

customer_reviews.title: Not so happy with the price now but it gives a great workout
customer_reviews.text: I’m so sad the price went as high as it did. Was looking into getting other one as a gift. Bought this in March for close to nothing. Love love love it, it is small for an apartment, easy to build, and gives a great work out however I do not see myself paying the price It is set to now for being so basic. Took one star away for the high price. Such a shocker.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in functionality.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed as to how this treadmill worked. I'm a bit larger and it's not a smooth track to step on. It gets stuck and doesn't move if you step too high on the track, or if you step too far down it goes so fast you can't keep up. Not a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, sticks a bit and stops moving for a second which almost made me stumble, by surprise of the sudden pause, but good enough to keep in my office for a small exercise break. Wish it moved smoother definitely can't let go of the handles or run faster though or I'd most likely trip due to it sticking or stopping of the band.
customer_reviews.author: Faron

customer_reviews.title: For me, priceless!
customer_reviews.text: Great little piece of equipment. Collapses, allowing the treadmill be gotten out of traffic when not in use. I am unable to use it more than five minutes at a time because of my neuoropathy but I have to force myself to keep moving, just not so much that I damage the muscle nerves more.
customer_reviews.author: Dr(PhD)Wes

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill!! It gives you a hard workout for sure! I could easily walk on an electric treadmill for 30 minutes or more, but after 5 minutes on this one I had to rest! I just wish the slope went a little higher on the backend so it would be like a flat surface, but I have read that other purchasers just propped the backend up to make it even!
customer_reviews.author: Tonni

customer_reviews.title: Its good for price
customer_reviews.text: Its good for price.. I love it honestly but i can tell it will at most last me a good 6 to 8 months hoping at most 12 months. Its as simple as you get what u pay for... I love the workout i get from it i will say if it was constructed better with more quality it would be perfect. For a manual treadmill. I'm gonna do my best to care for it and get all the use i can from the 118 dollars i spent.
customer_reviews.author: ashley rayborn

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill if you don’t have arthritic knees!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great treadmill if you do have any problem with your lower back or knees. If you have arthritis, the incline and self powered belt might be a problem for you, as it was for me. I had to return it and purchase a motorized treadmill, which will be better for me when I have my knee replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Hoped
customer_reviews.text: Returned due to problems. Not sturdy enough. Ended up buying another brand that was a little more expensive, but works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Lass

customer_reviews.title: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE!
customer_reviews.text: This ProGear 190 Manual Treadmill with twin flywheels is fantastic! I'll order another if this one ever gives out. Thanks, Peter
customer_reviews.author: Peter W. Nygard

customer_reviews.title: worst thing I have ever bought on amazon I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This product barley even works when I put it together the screws striped before they could even be tightened half way. I had to use a wrench to try to and tighten them and now it wobbles like crazy when I use it but since its striped I can't even take it apart to return it. Also the sensor does not work and the handle bars would not fit in correctly to screw them in. My five year old loves it he can use it with out it wobbling so basically I just spent $100 for a kids toy. Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany roy

customer_reviews.title: Light weight small
customer_reviews.text: Its smaller compared to motorized treadmill easy to move a single person can move to another room. assembly was easy. It takes some time to get used to it. On the first few uses it was difficult to slow down the speed but now I can adjust my speed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are very easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are very easy to follow. I think the folks having problems didn't read completely through the instructions. Looks like it will need occasional oiling and tightening. So far, it has worked great on daily use. My kids love it and with the low price, I don't freak out too much at them abusing it. I'm 245lbs and it is very sturdy. I did have to level it out some, otherwise I have to practically hold myself up the entire time due to the steep incline.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Owen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty handy for multitasking.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this treadmill to play video games and walk at the same time. Had to adjust the treadmill a little bit because if you let go of the handles you would start running. Just added a piece of wood under the back wheels making it slightly more level so I was able to walk and not run.
customer_reviews.author: Jenai

customer_reviews.title: very well-made
customer_reviews.text: This is great for small spaces. It folds up easily and I get a great work out. It has all the necessary features, time, distance, calories, etc. It's harder to use than a powered treadmill so I feel like I burn more calories. Extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: It works, but got a wrong bolt. Also small for running even if you are 5’6 135ish pounds. Handles keep moving when walking fast or running. They move up and down. So the whole thing moves. It’s not great and I have never been on a treadmill before.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm 65 years old and use this treadmill when I am unable to get outdoors. My son and daughter-in-law put it together in less than 30 minutes. It is solid, well-built and light-weight enough for me to move it anywhere in the house. Very well pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy G

customer_reviews.title: Love this treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Works great used books underneath so to slow it down but it’s sturdy I weighed 249 and it’s works great
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: The lock was welded incorrectly with made it impossible to ...
customer_reviews.text: The lock was welded incorrectly with made it impossible to keep the front of the machine down while walking. It's too steep not to hold on to the handles. When you grip the handles the whole front comes up. We had to drill bigger holes in it to be able to make a new stabilizer to make it function properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived used and the box was in shambles. The screws were in an old Ziploc bag. We sent it back the next day.
customer_reviews.author: CDA

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR-IT IS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to put together! I am amazed at how well this machine works at this price! Very quiet, folds easy but remember it does not go under the bed, but we have moved it around easy until we found the perfect spot. Pretty heavy, so if moving up the stairs, take it up in pieces
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline M. Mcguire

customer_reviews.title: Great little treadmill!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect, but this little treadmill surpassed my expectations. Takes up very little space, but offers a good workout. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of Baggins

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill. Such a great price. You have to hold the the rails to push it even at a slight incline, but it gives you a little extra burn. It was really easy to put together and stores really easy. I love it for fasted cardio in the morning. It rattles a little and I wish it had a reading stand.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill works perfectly for me. I am 5'2" and have limited space in my house. It was very easy to assemble and no adjustments were necessary. The belt tightens slightly on its own after about 5 uses. It is very quiet, allowing me to watch TV while exercising. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Gave it away after a month
customer_reviews.text: Kept it for a month. Found the surface very uncomfortable walking on. Would've been nice if the handles were a little higher/extended An ok piece of equipment but wasn't right for me I gave it away Again the main reason being the surface was very uncomfortable walking on
customer_reviews.author: BuRu

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: To be honest it’s okay I can’t lower the incline so I have to hold on while walking. It’s not made for running but it gets the job done for exercise since I can’t go to the gym!
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Marie

customer_reviews.title: Belt gets stuck often
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, very easy to fold and store, terrible for running. I bought this so that I could have an inclined surface to run on and the belt consistently gets stuck. If you increase the angle, you cannot run without holding on to the bars. If you attempt to do so, you will continuously speed up. I guess you get what you pay for. Will be returning
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but I do like it. I walk almost every day out side ...
customer_reviews.text: Harder to walk on then I thought it would be, but I do like it. I walk almost every day out side but this is a real hard workout for me, I am 77 years old and that might be why it is a bit rough to do it very long. Very sturdy , we are very happy with it especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Simple to put together. Works as it should. Its too small for my 6' son with long legs and a long stride but perfect for me (5'5).
customer_reviews.author: Tara Miller

customer_reviews.title: the good and the bad
customer_reviews.text: Good: worth at least 3x more than the price and is solid, easy to assemble and offers a neat workout..Bad: gives you NO reason, NO excuse for not getting in shape. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: Not for tall people
customer_reviews.text: If you are about 5'5" or taller this product is too short. I'm 5'7" and I feel like I'm bending over to hold on to the bars. I still use it, but it is a chore to work out. Will probably have to just bite the bullet and get an expensive one later:/
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mayer

customer_reviews.title: LOVED ITTTT
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it so far. It’s pretty sturdy and not so small as it shows in the picture. It gives you one hell of a work out even in 10 mins of walking. Y’all gotta learn how to stop and continue walking tho (not so hard) I’ll update if there’s any change in my review.
customer_reviews.author: Khadijah

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great item for price. The belt area is more narrow than most. And it’s manual, which means almost a tougher workout because you have to move the belt yourself. Easy to assemble. Sturdy. I wouldn’t suggest running on this due to the narrow belt width.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at its price point.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to set up and use with simple and well laid out instructions. Takes a little time getting accostomed to the manual approach vs. an electrified bed but I believe more beneficial. An occasional belt squeak but nothing seious. All said, good value and sound product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: broken upon arrival and came late
customer_reviews.text: Tracker came broken so not able to track time/distance. the belt does not line up correct underneath and it often gets caught while trying to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Bethannie F. Barajas

customer_reviews.title: Build it right, should be safe.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a builder but my man wanted to put it together for me :) It took a while for him to, but it works great! No complaints here. Could have taken less time, but it seems to be pretty safe if you assemble it right.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Gear

customer_reviews.title: Good at home workout
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something easy to move around the house and put away when done working out. This treadmill is perfect for both occasions. I like that it’s not too big.
customer_reviews.author: ricardo sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Easy to use. Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill. It was so easy to assemble. It had the best instructions I have ever seen for a product. It is easy to use and quiet. It’s not large so it’s easy to find a place to put it. I’m a 78 year old woman. So if I can put it together and use it, well you can too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeudic

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the person that likes to walk. It makes you pick your own pace, which for me, is more natural anyway. It is easy to move. You definitely can't go wrong with it unless you are one of those folks who wants a lot of "gizmos" that come with much more expensive treadmills.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Thurstin

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: What a great value! I could not believe the quality of this product. Easy to use. East to store in a closet. Rock solid when assembled. N Ronald Druckman
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is just as described—it works. It’s just no fuss, runs smooth, and since it’s in an incline, you’ll feel the workout with a walk. Nice and compact and looks solid.
customer_reviews.author: MMUSA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can walk while cooped up indoors. Solo assembly takes less than 30 minutes and the instructions are easy to follow. This is perfect for fast walking at home.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: You will probably receive a different treadmill
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was not the one I purchased. They announce it to have 2 inclines of: 6 and 10 DEGREES (correspond to approximately 12% and 20% incline) The treadmill I received has 3 options: 7, 8 and 9% The máximum incline doesn’t get close to the minimum incline as the description of this treadmill. The costumer service is not good, so take that into account when buying it
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: When runny hold on to the bars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing I love it I can walk on it run on it by holding the bars I felt it in my legs back and arms thank you so much
customer_reviews.author: Dottie Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic buy. Simple assembly, sturdy construction, works like a dream for a first rate home workout. I have it set up in a permanent spot, so I cannot speak to the portability to date, but overall, my highest approval. For the money, I recommend the Progear 190 treadmill wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: cool!
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble and to maintain. I like the way it does tricks. you have to know how to solve the tricks😜. it does give you the sweat. I wouldn't change this manual treadmill for the electric ones. it's fun. thank you, tom jeffries and jmr, for the tips on belt and 2x4 . they help.
customer_reviews.author: firefly

customer_reviews.title: Brisk walk achieved
customer_reviews.text: The one I received it slightly different than advertised as mine has a three level incline instead of the two (photo comparison with page from booklet attached). But I'm happy with this as two people with varying preferences are using it. Otherwise, it seems exactly the same. We were seeking something manual for daily walking only and we're perfectly happy with it's delivery.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: a little hard to get going at first. otherwise fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: Summer here is long and hot so i wanted someplace cool to start walking. This unit is perfect. Simple uncumplicated and not expensive. Yet it has a stylish look and feel about it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A.

customer_reviews.title: this is great. I miss being able to walk hands-free since ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is great. I miss being able to walk hands-free since my electric treadmill broke, however, this is convenient, easy to assemble, easy to use, and way better than nothing. I like that it stores away. My husband finds it hard to use. He says it sticks, but I've not had that problem. Once I get a rhythm going, I just keep going and going....I do wish it had a place for a water bottle. That would be my only adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: ladybug88888888

customer_reviews.title: thought this would be a nice inexpensive addition for poor weather days
customer_reviews.text: Simply just okay. I walk 20k plus steps a day, thought this would be a nice inexpensive addition for poor weather days. 45 min on this is enough as it's harder than it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Works For Me
customer_reviews.text: I'm over six feet tall and was concerned about the smallness of this treadmill, but I use it like riding a bike with leaning over bars. Gives me a very good work out. True this is not designed to run on or for tall person to stand upright (as picture) on but I'm older and running does not fit my workouts any more. Very well made and I've had zero problems during assembling and use.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good easy to use Treadmill. You can really feel the burn
customer_reviews.author: Andy’sReviews

customer_reviews.title: NO RUNNING?! IT DOES NOT SPECIFY NO RUNNING! WOULD RETURN
customer_reviews.text: NO RUNNING?! IT DOES NOT SPECIFY NO RUNNING! WOULD RETURN BUT I WOULD HAVE TO PACK IT UP, AND I CANT DISSASEMBLE
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and work
customer_reviews.text: Every day, I use this to do walking exercise at home, just 15 mins, I am sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Received the treadmill and the top wires are damaged so the tracker is not working
customer_reviews.author: Jes

product_meta.title: ProGear 190 Manual Treadmill with 2 Level Incline and Twin Flywheels
product_meta.description: The ProGear 190 Space Saver and treadmill fitness walking is an effective way to burn extra calories and achieve a healthy lifestyle. Walking on a manual treadmill is one of the easiest and most effective ways to achieve a regimen of regular exercise. Fitness walking can help you lose body fat, tone muscles and is a great way to stay in shape. The ProGear 190 Manual Treadmill gives you benefits of minimal assembly out of the box, uses no electrical power and is maintenance free. Tested up to 230lbs of user weight. Steel Frame with powder coated finish. Wide side rails for safety. Oversized belt rollers provide a very smooth and consistent walking experience. Longer handles with foam grips provide for walking security and loss of balance. Incline adjustments feature quick and easy 2 position incline levels of 6 and 10 degrees. Some assembly required. Twin cast iron flywheels for smooth and quiet walking. Transportation wheels allow the treadmill to be moved easily from room to room. Treadmill Belt size 43"L x 13 1/4" W. Folds up easily for storage. Folded Dimensions 21"L x 23"W x 51"H. Computer has an LCD display featuring elapsed time, distance walked, calories burned, speed and scan.
feature_bullets: Tested up to 230lbs of user weight
Steel Frame with powder coated finish, Wide side rails for safety
Oversized belt rollers provide a very smooth and consistent walking experience
Incline adjustments feature quick and easy 2 position incline levels of 6 and 10 degrees
Longer handles with foam grips provide for walking security and loss of balance
